conclusion: Liquid flows out from points A, B, and C.
Liquid from point A flows downward and encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
After passing the first baffle, liquid from point A continues downward and encounters another baffle directing it further to the right.
Liquid from point A reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid from point B flows downward and encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the left.
After passing the first baffle, liquid from point B continues downward and encounters another baffle directing it further to the left.
Liquid from point B reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
Liquid from point C flows downward and encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the left.
After passing the first baffle, liquid from point C continues downward and encounters another baffle directing it further to the left.
Liquid from point C reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
The baffles play a crucial role in directing the flow of the liquid.
The direction of the baffles determines whether the liquid will be directed towards the left or the right.
The final position of the liquid depends on the cumulative effect of these directional changes.
Liquid from point A will flow into container E; liquid from points B and C will flow into container D.
